title: Remainders
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. James H. Beal
provenance_text:
Benton Murdoch Spruance [1904-1967], Philadelphia, PA; Charles Sessler, Inc., Philadelphia, PA, until November 1957; Mr. [1898-1987] and Mrs. James H. Beal (born Rebecca Huebley Jones) [1898-1993], Pittsburgh, PA, November 1957 until April 11, 1967 [1]; gift to Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, April 1967 [2].

Notes:
[1]. Charles Sessler, Inc. invoiced Mrs. Beal $250 for "#32 Gouache Remainders" on October 28, 1957. Payment was sent on November 7, 1957 and acknowledged on November 12, 1957. The work was mailed to Mrs. Beal in late November 1957, care of Carnegie Institute, after the close of the Spruance exhibition at Sessler Gallery; Mrs. Beal had the work in her possession by March 1958 (see curatorial file.)
[2]. The gouache was accessioned on April 11, 1967.
